definition: to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)

sentences.english: I can certainly picture being ill.
sentences.chinese: 我肯定能够想象自己生病。

sentences.english: We are modeling them as hard spheres.
sentences.chinese: 我们把它们想象为硬球体。

sentences.english: Imagine a tick-tack-toe grid in your viewfinder.
sentences.chinese: 想象取景器中一点一点移动的栅格。

sentences.english: I think you get the picture.
sentences.chinese: 我想你能想象到这个画面。

sentences.english: Perhaps we all knew - or, at least, imagined - that it would be this way.
sentences.chinese: 或许我们都知道，或者至少可以想象他可能是这样的。
他们无法想象向熊扔石头的做法。

sentences.english: I can't imagine what it will say.
sentences.chinese: 我无法想象这期节目将要说什么。

sentences.english: But they were uttered only within his imagination.
sentences.chinese: 其实只是在他的想象之中发出了声。

sentences.english: Intriguingly, this could mean the device is even older than thought.
sentences.chinese: 有趣的是，这意味着这个装置可能比想象的还要古老。

sentences.english: Throughout their history, the pyramids of Giza have stimulated human imagination.
sentences.chinese: 纵观历史，吉萨金子塔激发了人类的想象。

sentences.english: And what do those visiting Karneval dress up as? Everything imaginable.
sentences.chinese: 看看这些科隆狂欢节参与者的打扮，发挥你的想象吧。

sentences.english: I went to the sofa to rest and imagine tomorrow's sunset.
sentences.chinese: 我坐到沙发上去休息，想象着明天的日落会是怎样。

sentences.english: What they say is almost unimaginably painful to me.
sentences.chinese: 他们所说的对我来说几乎是无法想象的痛苦。

sentences.english: In science, the obvious role of imagination is in the context of discovery.
sentences.chinese: 在科学中，想象在发现的过程中发挥了明显的作用。

sentences.english: The tale wittily explores the interaction and tension between reality and imagination.
sentences.chinese: 这篇故事机智地探讨了现实和想象之间的联系和对立。

sentences.english: I could only imagine what he intended to do to me.
sentences.chinese: 由此，我完全可以想象到，他将如何对付我。

definition: to imagine/to assume/to envisage/tentative plan/to have consideration for
to know from experience/to learn through experience/to realize/understanding/experience
like that/in that way/or so/so/so very much/about/in that case
to sense/perception/to feel (through the senses)/to experience/a feeling/an impression/an experience
